channel.title: Oof Be Told
channel.description: This is the RSS feed for web related articles by Oof.

item.title: 5 Reasons Why You Need RSS
item.description: RSS is a web feed format that allows content creators to syndicate their content as feeds, updating subscribers when new items are added. Subscribers use feed reading applications to track which websites they've subscribed to, and new items from these feeds are presented in a unified space for easy browsing. Introduced in 1999, RSS became the first widely adopted content subscription mechanism on the World Wide Web.

item.title: The Future is an Installable Web
item.description: This is the second blog post on Oof Be Told.
